sorcer.core.provider

Class ProviderDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • sorcer.core.provider.ProviderDelegate

  • public class ProviderDelegate
extends java.lang.Object
    There are two types of SORCER service servers: generic service servers - subclasses of ServiceProvider - and service beans - classes of implementing one or more SORCER service types. This class does the actual work for both generic SORCER servers and SORCER service beans. Also it provides the basic functionality for Providers. Multiple SORCER beans can be deployed within a single (@link ServiceProvider}.
    See Also:
    ServiceProvider

      • getAttributes

        public net.jini.core.entry.Entry[] getAttributes()
        Creates the service attributes to be used with Jini lookup services.

        This function will create the following args:

        • A Name.
        • A SorcerServiceInfoentry with all the information about this provider.
        • A main UIDescriptor if the provider overrides
        • Extra lookup attributes setValue via #addExtraLookupAttribute(Entry)
        Returns:
        an array of Jini Service Entries.
        Throws:
        net.jini.config.ConfigurationException

        public boolean unexport(boolean force)
                 throws java.rmi.NoSuchObjectException
        Unexports the services of this provider appropriately.
        Parameters:
        force - terminate in progress calls if necessary
        Returns:
        true if unexport succeeds
        Throws:
        java.rmi.NoSuchObjectException

      • createAdmin

      • getAdminProxy

        public java.lang.Object getAdminProxy()

      • getProxy

        public java.lang.Object getProxy()
        Returns a proxy object for this provider. If the smart proxy is alocated then returns a non exported object to be registerd with loookup services. However, if a smart proxy is defined then the provider's proxy is setValue as its inner proxy. Otherwise the Remote outer proxy of this provider is returned.
        Returns:
        a proxy, or null
        See Also:
        ServiceProvider.getProxy()
